DataElement.preferredName: PRETEXT Staging System Primary Childhood Malignant Liver Tumor Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary liver tumor prior to treatment using the PRETEXT staging system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PRETEXT Staging System Primary Neoplasm Childhood Malignant Liver Neoplasm Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A staging system designed by the International Childhood Liver Tumor Strategy Group (SIOPEL) for staging and risk stratification of liver tumors. A PRETEXT stage number is based on the number of contiguous liver sections not involved by tumor, corresponding to a rough estimate of the difficulty of the expected surgical procedure. It is used to describe tumor extent before any therapy, thus allowing more effective comparison between studies conducted by different groups._A tumor at the original site of origin._A malignant neoplasm of the liver developed in childhood.  Representative examples include hepatoblastoma, undifferentiated (embryonal) sarcoma, and extrarenal rhabdoid tumor._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A staging system designed by the International Childhood Liver Tumor Strategy Group (SIOPEL) for staging and risk stratification of liver tumors. A PRETEXT stage number is based on the number of contiguous liver sections not involved by tumor, corresponding to a rough estimate of the difficulty of the expected surgical procedure. It is used to describe tumor extent before any therapy, thus allowing more effective comparison between studies conducted by different groups.

Concepts.definition: A staging system designed by the International Childhood Liver Tumor Strategy Group (SIOPEL) for staging and risk stratification of liver tumors. A PRETEXT stage number is based on the number of contiguous liver sections not involved by tumor, corresponding to a rough estimate of the difficulty of the expected surgical procedure. It is used to describe tumor extent before any therapy, thus allowing more effective comparison between studies conducted by different groups.

Property.preferredName: Primary Neoplasm Childhood Malignant Liver Neoplasm Stage
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor at the original site of origin.:A malignant neoplasm of the liver developed in childhood.  Representative examples include hepatoblastoma, undifferentiated (embryonal) sarcoma, and extrarenal rhabdoid tumor.:The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A tumor at the original site of origin.
A malignant neoplasm that affects the liver and occurs during childhood.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A staging system designed by the International Childhood Liver Tumor Strategy Group (SIOPEL) for staging and risk stratification of liver tumors. A PRETEXT stage number is based on the number of contiguous liver sections not involved by tumor, corresponding to a rough estimate of the difficulty of the expected surgical procedure. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Disease System stage in which tumor involves all four quadrants of the liver. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: PRETEXT (Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Tumor) stage in which the tumor involves all four quadrants of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Disease System stage in which tumor involves three adjoining quadrants or two nonadjoining quadrants, while one quadrant or two nonadjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: PRETEXT (Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Tumor) stage in which the tumor involves three adjoining quadrants or two nonadjoining quadrants, while one quadrant or two nonadjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Disease System stage in which tumor involves two adjoining quadrants, while the other two adjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: PRETEXT (Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Tumor) stage in which the tumor involves two adjoining quadrants, while the other two adjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Disease System stage in which tumor involves only one quadrant, while the three adjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: PRETEXT (Hepatoblastoma Pretreatment Extent of Tumor) stage in which the tumor involves only one quadrant, while the three adjoining liver quadrants are free of tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
